transcripts.text: Well, one angle I've been thinking through this recently has been just the lens of hospitality, extending the hospitality of God as sort of a phrase we've been using at our church.  And a lot of that, you know, I think a lot of people today are lonely, are isolated, or way more connected than ever before online and those kind of things, but often way more isolated.  And the power of actually creating a space and welcoming people into it.  So an example of that, a buddy of mine, John Crawford, had this idea, and he and I have just been, we're implementing it this month actually, has been, taking all of our community groups, we have all these community groups that meet during the week, and basically taking a week off, so to speak, so the week before we're prepping everyone on kind of hospitality and how to do this, but then taking a week off where actually instead of gathering as a community that week, individuals and families from the group are all intentionally praying over and inviting someone that they know over to their home for a meal, or if they don't have a good home, they're going out to coffee or whatever, And we've tried to equip them with some intentional questions they can ask, not putting people on the spot, but actually truly get to know more about people's lives and what they believe and what they think with the goal of hospitality.  And I think one of the things that we've found is I think people are hungry to be known and to actually have a space to share some of their story and their outlook on the world.  And we want to bathe that in prayer.  The week before going into it and the week after, taking time to pray for those conversations, to pray for the people, to share together when we regather as communities with what took place there and just see how God might move.  I think we often underestimate the power of prayer.  But when I first became a Christian, I remember talking to this friend of mine.  He was an older gentleman, and he just seemed to always be having conversations with people about Jesus.  And he was talking about it.  He'd say, oh, yeah, I just had this great conversation with someone.  And I asked him, I was like, how do you do that?  Like, how do you do evangelism, you know?  And he looked at me kind of strangely.  He's like, I just pray.  I ask God every week, I pray, God, would you bring me the right person to to speak to you?  Would you make me attentive to where I can recognize the time?  Would you give me the words to  say?".  And God responded to those prayers.
